title: State of Jurisprudence v. Elias Vance (fictional) - Sexually Violent Predator Risk Assessment
court: Superior Court of the State of Alta, County of Haven
question: Does Mr. Vance meet the statutory criteria for commitment as a Sexually Violent Predator (SVP), specifically, is he a person who has been convicted of a sexually violent offense and currently suffers from a mental abnormality or personality disorder that makes him a menace to the health and safety of others because it is likely that he will engage in predatory acts of sexual violence?
summary: This is a post-sentence, pre-release risk assessment to determine if Elias Vance meets the criteria for civil commitment as a Sexually Violent Predator (SVP). The evaluation focuses on his Paraphilic Disorder (Sexual Sadism), extensive criminal history, and high static/dynamic risk scores.

documents.description: Comprehensive psychological and forensic psychiatric report detailing history, testing, diagnosis, and final risk determination.
Excerpt of Dr. Reed's direct examination testimony regarding her findings and risk conclusion.
Initial letter from defense counsel outlining their challenges to the state's petition and requesting clarification on the static risk assessment scoring.

key_findings: Diagnosis of Paraphilic Disorder, Other Specified (Sexual Sadism, non-consenting partners only) and Antisocial Personality Disorder.
Historical risk factors (static) are exceptionally high, with an elevated PCL-R score of 35/40 (Factor 1: 18, Factor 2: 17).
Statistically significant high risk for sexual recidivism as measured by the Static-99R (Score 8, High Risk) and the VRAG-R (Classification Group 9, 81.3% estimated risk over 10 years).
Dynamic risk factors remain poorly managed; Mr. Vance has shown minimal engagement and limited insight into the function of his paraphilia or the impact of his criminality during his incarceration.
The mental abnormality (Paraphilic Disorder) is judged to be volitional and linked to the likelihood of future predatory sexual violence.
Mr. Vance meets the statutory criteria for commitment as a Sexually Violent Predator.
